title: Pierre Soulages, Leading French Abstract Painter, Dies at 102
description: Once called “the world’s greatest living artist,” Mr. Soulages was best known for exploring the possibilities of the color black.
dc:creator: William Grimes

media:content.media:credit: Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York/ADAGP, Paris; Sandra Mehl for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Pierre Soulages in 2019. He found a world of texture, light and even color in black, creating paintings that established him as France’s pre-eminent postwar abstract painter.
